newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: AMP Society says hard to repeat 1996 profit result.
newsitem.headline: AMP Society says hard to repeat 1996 profit result.

text.p: The Australian Mutual Provident Society (AMP) said on Monday that it would be difficult to repeat its calendar 1996 net profit of A$2.1 billion in the current year.
"It was a high figure and one that will be very hard to match in 1997," deputy managing director Kerry Roberts told reporters.
AMP, Australia's largest insurance company and funds management group, said earlier that the latest year profit compared with 1995 net earnings of A$1.9 billion.
The company said lower acitivity in investment markets pushed total income down by A$2 billion to A$16 billion in the latest year.

"While we are not yet satisfied with the operating performance and returns in our major businesses, 1996 did continue the positive trend toward our established operating targets," AMP managing director George Trumbull said in a statement.

The company, which operates a mutual society owned by its policyholders, last December decided to pursue a demutualisation strategy which will probably see it listed on the stock exchange in the medium term.
